name: Tricep Dumbbell Kickback
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on a flat surface with your back straight and engaged, such as a bench or the floor.

2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your arm extended behind you at shoulder height, palm facing backward. Keep your elbow close to your body and only use your triceps to control the movement.

3. Bend your knees slightly if necessary to maintain posture while engaging your core to keep your upper body stable.

4. Slowly lift the dumbbell up by extending your arm fully, squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.

5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then very slowly return the dumbbell to its starting position on your back without losing control or momentum.

6. Keep your core engaged and maintain posture throughout the exercise. Repeat for desired number of repetitions, alternating arms between sets.
short_summary: Tricep Dumbbell Kickbacks are a isolation exercise targeting the triceps.
